title: Description
text: added tests code changed/added added documentation code changed/added made sure naming new functions self-explanatory consistent

title: Using gDRstyle
text: gDRstyle package intended used development packages within gDR platform. 3 primary uses: (1)set style guide functions check style upheld, (2) CI ensure code passes R CMD check maintain state code high quality, (3) package dependency installation gDR platform image building.

title: Using gDRstyle
text: See written Style guide. function lintPkgDirs can used ensure package appropriately linted.

title: Using gDRstyle
text: checkPackage function check package abides gDRstyle stylistic requirements, passes rcmdcheck, ensures dependencies.yml file used build gDR platform’s docker image kept --date dependencies listed package’s DESCRIPTION file. called gDR platform packages’ CI/CD.

title: Using gDRstyle
text: function installAllDeps assists installing package dependencies.

title: gDR style guide
text: Indentation 2 spaces indentation Use spaces Always utilize ( ( Always include spaces around logical comparison 1 == 1 1==1 Always include spaces around logical entity (1 == 1) {} (1=1){} Always include spaces around “full” subsets [ , subset] [, subset] Naming conventions Utilize lower_snake_case variables Assignment use <- = variable name reflect proper tense validated_se <- validate_SE() validate_se <- validate_SE() Utilize space function arguments function(= "") function(="") Utilize lower_snake_case function arguments function(big_matrix) function(bigMatrix) action functions start verbs compute_metrics_SE metrics_SE internal functions start . Utilize lowerCamelCase function names Function names short informative Getters start get*, setters start set*, boolean checkers start * Functions, functions, functions Functions definition start line function name Every parameter separate line Prepare separate functions complicated defaults (function parameters) Always utilize <- = differentiate function arguments assignments function assignments myFunction <- function() myFunction = function() internal functions exported exported functions assert tests parameters vapply sapply (lapply + unlist() predefining FUN.VALUE difficult) use apply data.frame(s) (mapply good row-wise operations) Use implicit returns explicit Use curly braces else statements surrounded curly braces line Assign simple -else statements variable. Files possible, break code smaller files Separate function 2 lines Tests named identically file R/ (R/assays => tests/testthat/test-assays.R) Namespacing double colon namespace packages imported package.R includes: checkmate, SummarizedExperiment, etc. Tests expect_equal(obs, exp) expect_equal(exp, obs) Miscellaneous Exponentiation: always utilize ^ ** exponentiation like 2 ^ 3 2**3. Numerics: place 0’s front decimals like 0.1 .1 Use named indexing positional indexing df[, "alias"] <- df[, "celllinename"] df[, 1] <- df[, 2] df[, fxn_that_returns_idx(x):length(x)] <- NA df[, 2:length(x)] <- NA Reassign repeated logic variable computed .
code: # Good fun <- function(param1,                 param2,                 param_with_dir_for_st_important = get_st_important_dir()) {   # Code is indented by two spaces.   ... }  # Bad fun <- function(param1, param2, param_with_dir_for_st_important = file.path(system.file(paste(param1, "SE", "rds", sep = "."), package = "important_package"))) {   ... } # Good.   foo <- function() {     # Do stuff.     x   }   # Bad.   foo <- function() {     # Do stuff.     return(x)   } if (TRUE) {   NULL } else {   NULL } ## NULL what_is_going_on <- if (is_check()) {   flog <- "it's getting hot..." } else if (is_mate()) {   flog <- "Oh noooo..." } else {   flog <- "there is a hope..." } # Good. idx <- foo() if (length(idx) == 1) {   f <- c(f[idx], f[-idx]) } # Bad. if (length(foo()) == 1) {   f <- c(f[foo()], f[foo()]) }

title: gDR style guide
text: use absolute IDs (non-namespaced IDs) inside modules. breaks modularity. adding identifier element order style CSS, always prefer classes IDs, work naturally modules can reused. Avoid inline CSS styles. CSS file, rule line. Avoid using percentages widths; instead, use bootstrap’s grid system specifying columns.

title: gDR style guide
text: Create file {pkgname}-package.R usethis::use_package_doc() Update {pkgname}-package.R - lines: Add DESCRIPTION Roxygen: list(markdown = TRUE) constants, imports side-effects tools file package.R. use zzz.R functions/packages often used within package, add @import @importFrom always one place - file package.R using function another package, use namespace::function_name Executes gDRstyle specific package checks gDRstyle::checkPackage() (use bioc_check = TRUE verify requirements Bioconductor also met)
code: #' @note To learn more about functions start with `help(package = "{pkgname}")`  #' @keywords internal #' @return package help page "_PACKAGE" ## [1] "_PACKAGE"

title: gDR style guide
text: Follow Conventional Commits fix: bugfixes; feat: new features; docs: documentation changes; style: formatting changes affect meaning code; test: adding missing tests correcting existing tests; refactor: code changes neither fixes bug adds feature ci: changes CI configuration change code accompanied bumped version. new features - PATCH version; bugfixes changes - MINOR version. Exceptions: public packages - --released Bioconductor version 0.99.x. changes code accompanied bumped MINOR version regardless nature changes.

title: Check R package — checkPackage
text: Used gDR platform pacakges' CI/CD pipelines check package abides gDRstyle stylistic requirements, passes rcmdcheck, ensures dependencies.yml file used build gDR platform's docker image kept --date dependencies listed package's DESCRIPTION file.

title: Check R package — checkPackage
code: checkPackage(   pkgName,   repoDir,   subdir = NULL,   fail_on = "warning",   bioc_check = FALSE,   run_examples = TRUE,   skip_lint = FALSE,   skip_tests = FALSE,   build_vignettes = TRUE,   check_vignettes = TRUE )

title: Check R package — checkPackage
text: pkgName String package name. repoDir String path repository directory. subdir String relative path R package root directory repoDir. fail_on String specifying level check fail. Supported values: "note", "warning" (default) "error". bioc_check Logical whether bioc check performed run_examples Logical whether examples check performed skip_lint skip lint checks skip_tests skip tests build_vignettes build vignettes check_vignettes check vignettes

what:
Assume there is a valid note:

> checking R code for possible problems ... NOTE
mini_app: no visible binding for '<<-' assignment to ‘CONFIG’


and we want every other note in this section (and others) to fail check.
Accepted NOTE has 2 lines, therefore the length = 2. Then we want to
check whether the content of this NOTE is correct, so we take one of
the lines (eg. index_to_check = 2) and grep for content of this line
(eg. text_to_check =
